decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly assembling a combo involving Amalia Benavides Aguirre and Aetherflux Reservoir to gain a massive amount of life and then use that life to win the game in one big burst. The deck includes cards like Fauna Shaman and Chord of Calling to search for key combo pieces, as well as cards like Collected Company and Return to the Ranks to help refill the board with creatures. The strategy revolves around efficiently gaining and using life to fuel the win condition.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and apply pressure on the opponent. It includes low-cost instant and sorcery spells like Consider, Fiery Impulse, and Lightning Axe to trigger the Phoenix's ability. The deck also includes cards like Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster to further enable graveyard plays. The addition of cards like Ashiok, Dream Render and Treasure Cruise provide additional disruption and card advantage, allowing for a consistent aggro strategy with powerful finishers like Arclight Phoenix.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's strategy through hand disruption and removal spells, while also generating value from cards in the graveyard with cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Graveyard Trespasser. The deck aims to control the game through a combination of removal, discard spells, and card advantage engines to outvalue the opponent over the course of the game. It also includes utility lands like Hive of the Eye Tyrant and Geier Reach Sanitarium to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing efficient creatures and removal spells to control the battlefield and deal damage quickly. With a mix of low-cost creatures like Dusk Legion Zealot and powerful finishers like Bloodtithe Harvester, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and close out games before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and Vein Ripper provide additional ways to push through damage and disrupt opposing strategies, making this deck a potent and versatile option in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Amalia Life and various creatures to generate life gain and card advantage. The deck includes cards like Aetherflux Reservoir, Chord of Calling, Collected Company, and Return to the Ranks to search for key pieces and set up the combo. Cards like Prosperous Innkeeper, Wildgrowth Walker, and Lunarch Veteran provide life gain, while Selfless Savior and Skyclave Apparition offer protection and disruption. The goal is to accumulate a high life total and then use Aetherflux Reservoir to deal lethal damage to the opponent.

This deck revolves around utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast powerful spells and combo off. By using cards like Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings to untap Lotus Field, the deck is able to produce a massive amount of mana in a single turn. This mana is then used to cast game-winning spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience. The deck also includes tools like Archdruid's Charm and Bala Ged Recovery to find and protect key pieces of the combo.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Spirit creatures and using them to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By playing cheap and efficient creatures like Spectral Sailor and Mausoleum Wanderer, along with powerful lords like Supreme Phantom, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain it throughout the game. Additionally, cards like Shacklegeist and Geistlight Snare help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Curious Obsession and Brazen Borrower provide additional utility and flexibility. The inclusion of Faceless Haven and Otawara, Soaring City offer alternative win conditions and resilience against removal spells.

This aggressive deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix while disrupting the opponent's strategy with targeted removal and counter spells. It also utilizes card draw and filtering to dig through the deck efficiently. The inclusion of Hall of Storm Giants provides a potentially game-ending threat with its activated ability. Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster add additional ways to interact with the opponent's resources. Ashiok, Dream Render disrupts graveyard strategies, while Galvanic Iteration and Temporal Trespass offer powerful late-game plays.

This deck is focused on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeatable damage, while also utilizing cards like Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes card draw and spell recursion to maintain momentum and pressure the opponent, with counterspells like Spell Pierce to protect key plays. The key strategy is to efficiently dig through the deck, generate card advantage, and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays using the powerful Arclight Phoenix.
